meanings.definition: Of poor quality or taste; vulgar or cheap.
meanings.sent1: The movie was so trashy that I couldn't even finish watching it.
meanings.sent2: She always wears such trashy clothes to school.
meanings.sent3: I can't believe you bought that trashy shirt, it looks ridiculous on you.
meanings.sent4: Her trashy behavior at the party was a real eye-opener for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant had a trashy atmosphere that made me lose my appetite.

meanings.sent1: The broken toy was now just a trashy piece of plastic.
meanings.sent2: His excuses for being late were so trashy that no one believed him.
meanings.sent3: I found a trashy old book in the attic that no one had read in years.
meanings.sent4: Her promises turned out to be as trashy as the paper they were written on.
meanings.sent5: The old vase was so chipped and trashy that it was practically worthless.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of as worthless.
meanings.sent1: I need to trashy these old magazines to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent2: She decided to trashy all the broken dishes instead of trying to fix them.
meanings.sent3: After the party, we had to trashy all the empty bottles and cans.
meanings.sent4: He had to trashy his old habits in order to make positive changes in his life.
meanings.sent5: The company had to trashy the faulty products to maintain their reputation for quality.
